While the world’s busy competing with one another, be among those who are busy competing with ourselves. Be better than you were yesterday. Work hard. Never put others down to elevate yourself. People will see through it. Be kind to all you meet. The right people will value you.

No matter what you’ve done in life, always believe that your transformation is possible. It’s only a call away. The Almighty’s waiting for you to turn back to Him. His Mercy is overwhelming, you could never imagine. So all is not lost if you seek His forgiveness and start over!

Keep some things private between you & the Almighty. There are some things you need only to confide in Him alone! Remember, not everyone needs to know what you’re doing, what’s going on in your life etc. The less people know about you, the better. Privacy is a prized possession!

This disease is so rampant. Many suffer from it. Stop comparing yourself to others. Break the habit of feeling insecure, envious & discontented with your life. One of the main reasons is social media! Remember, wanting what others have is a waste of time; live your own life!

Your mind can be your best friend or worst enemy. Train it well. If you don’t, it will assume it’s your master & it shall do as it pleases, it will spiral into negativity, depression & it becomes a force that drags you down instead of helping you. Always steer it to positivity!

Life’s a process. You can’t have a haphazard journey and expect to emerge top. Though you may not like what you are going through right now, your struggle is preparing you for your next level. Embrace the trials that come your way. Trust the Almighty to be your Guide & Protector!

You will be offended by some people at some point in your life. Don’t take it to heart. Don’t keep it inside you. Holding on to hurt and pain will only harm you in the long run.  Choose to forgive. Release the baggage of your past. Let it go and let the Almighty heal you!

Almighty.  Despite life’s uncertainties, we know You’re directing our steps towards all that’s good. May Your Mercy surround us every moment. Our hearts are strengthened because we have hope in You. We know You’ll open doors that we didn’t even knock on. Keep us firm in faith!

Even the most "genuine" people can fool you. In this day & age it’s hard to tell who’s a true friend. So you go through life hoping people are being sincere & genuine. But be prepared to be let down. It’s part of life. People will hurt you. Only the Almighty can heal you!

Don’t complicate life. Don’t overthink. Don’t create problems that aren’t there in the first place. Live simply. There’s no need for excesses. The Almighty wants ease for us. He won’t burden us with that which we have no capacity to bear. So take life in your stride. Just live!

There are some whose mission in life is to criticise, hate & look for things negative. They bring absolutely no value to your life. Quit worrying about them. Don’t let them sidetrack you from your real cause. Let the Almighty deal with them. Focus on those with a positive impact!

Be kind to yourself. Show yourself some mercy. Give yourself time and space to process all that’s going on in your mind. Don’t let anyone rush you or make you anxious. Remember, it’s your journey, nobody else’s. Take charge of it. Seek your strength from the One who made you!

There will be things that happen in your life which you can’t comprehend. That’s okay. The Almighty works in amazing ways which our minds cannot fathom at times. Don’t try to understand everything. You’ll end up frustrated. You just have to trust Him. That’s where faith comes in!

Worry won’t get you far. Most of the things you worry about are insignificant. You can’t control them anyway. It’s the Almighty’s way of showing you who’s in charge. So focus on being the best version of yourself. Be a sterling example & role model. Hand over the rest to Him!

Don’t suffer in silence. Don’t keep it all bottled up inside. Share it with the Almighty. Take Him into your confidence. Tell Him everything. He’s the only One who will listen and respond. He’s the only One who can and will give you that inner peace you long and crave for.

Quit worrying! Learn to trust the Almighty in all circumstances, even when you can’t see the full picture. He knows what to give you, when to give you. He knows what you need & when you need it. He knows how to put you at the right place at the right time with the right people.

We’ve all felt helpless, hopeless and powerless many times. But giving up is never an option. Hope is what keeps us alive. So no matter what’s going on out there, cling on to hope, knowing that the Almighty is with us always. He knows what’s going on even when we don’t!

Whatever the circumstances, pray! Pray when you’re happy. Pray when you’re confused & sad. Pray when it hurts. Pray when you’re lost. Pray when those around you mock you for praying. Pray when you have no idea what’s going on. Pray in search of peace of mind. Stability. Serenity!

Be mindful how you use social media. It’s becoming more hostile recently. Never forget that social media is a tool. We decide how the tool is used. Use it to spread goodness &  positivity; the ripple effects can be tremendous. Avoid bad words, no matter what they say about you!

Unfortunately, our society has low tolerance for those who fail. In fact, many success stories start with failure. Failure makes you tougher. It helps to redirect you in the right direction. Embrace failure for it’s a sign that you’re trying & that’s good enough for the Almighty!

Almighty. Help us understand that even when faced with fear & anxiety, You’re there to comfort us. May we not fret & worry over what lies ahead & instead learn to trust You in all our affairs. When the world feels out of control, make us turn to prayer to calm our hearts. Aameen.

Almighty. We hand over everything to You, knowing that You’re the Best of Planners. Ease our worries of yesterday so that it doesn’t rob us of our peace today. Help us to focus on things that truly matter and to channel our energies for the best outcome.

We live in a world that’s obsessed with gaining more. More wealth, fame, money, attention, friends, etc. We forget to appreciate what we have along the way. Don’t be surprised when the Almighty decides to take away what He’s blessed you with because you were so distracted!

Understand the Almighty’s plan as you journey on. Accept the challenges along the way. Know that nothing happens by accident. Everything is carefully planned by the Master Planner. So don’t get upset when tests come your way. They are there for a reason. Keep moving forward.

Are you the person who sees the glass as half full rather than half empty? Remember, being positive is one of the main things you need for survival. Your ability to do this, no matter what life throws at you is key to being happy & appreciating where you are in life. Thank Him!

We suffer from information overload. Many people obsess over how much news & updates they need to know to stay on top of things. In fact, learn to be mindful of how much news you consume. Learn to exercise restraint. You DON’T need to know everything!

Let’s make today the day we change the way we respond to people & things around us. We need to take control of how we react to things. Be conscious of the decisions we make. Remember, we don’t always get to choose the circumstances, but we certainly get to choose how we respond!

You’re allowed to have questions & you’ll not have the answers to everything that’s going on around you. That’s the Almighty’s job. Seek Him always. In good & bad times. He’s always there for you. He’s your source of light. You don’t have to shoulder the shadows on your own.

Learn to stay calm in a world that is so chaotic today. Whatever you can’t control, hand it over to the Almighty. Do your best with the rest that life has offered you. Don’t compare yourself with others. We all deal with things differently. Accept the differences. Respectfully!

Many of us are fooled into believing that strength is what we can do. No. Strength is more importantly overcoming the things we once thought we couldn't do. Learn to focus your heart and mind to it. Believe in yourself and seek help from the Almighty. You’ll get there eventually!

One of our biggest pitfalls is we assume we have time. So we put off till tomorrow what we were supposed to do today. Many thought the same. But death overtook them. Don’t lose out. Let this world run its race. We run after the Hereafter which is eternal. May we all get there!

We feel exhausted at times, on the verge of giving up. We even lower our expectations. But we have to persevere because only the Almighty knows when the time is right. Keep our faith firm while waiting, trusting You always. Aameen

You’re not a failure. You’re not doomed. You’re not worthless. Everyone makes mistakes in life. Everyone falls. Even champions. The difference is they get up and try again. Have another go at it. Don’t stay down. Have firm faith. It’s not over yet. If you quit, that’s the end.

Do you have friends who will tell you what you need to hear rather than what you want to hear? If you do, you’re blessed. Such people are rare these days. They’re the ones who will keep you humble, keep you grounded, keep you sane & keep you going. Remember to keep them close.

Learn to be less reactive for your own good. It’s easy to  blurt out what you feel in the heat of the moment without any regard for others. But remember, it takes only a few seconds of hurtful words to penetrate deep into someone’s heart. They may take years to heal, if at all!

Don’t let anyone belittle your efforts, no matter how small. If you’re doing your best, that’s all that matters. The Almighty has brought you this far. Look at where you are today. Quit overthinking. If you ever doubt yourself, remember how you started and how far you’ve come!

Almighty. Grant us peace of mind & calm our troubled hearts. Remove all things that are causing stress, sorrow &  grief in our lives. We lay our burdens before You; our worries, anxieties & fear. Keep us constant in prayers & may we always be grateful instead of wanting more!
Almighty. We ask You to lighten our load, grant us direction and strength to see through our day. We trust You to direct our steps and actions. May Your goodness and Mercy surround us always. Aameen.

Life has a way of unfolding when you least expect it. You’ll be betrayed by those you trusted. You’ll fall out with so-called friends. Don’t despair. The Almighty is in full control. He knows who should go & who should stay. He will pave a way out for you. Keep going. Trust Him!

Be committed to your spiritual growth. It’s not an easy journey. Satan is waiting & lurking around the corner to sidetrack you. If you don't commit to it, slowly you’ll shift down, lose your vision & start talking & behaving like those who don't care about their Creator. Beware!

Don’t jump to conclusions. Things aren’t always what they seem. Our conclusions may be logical but they may not be true. By refraining from making the wrong assumptions, we can avoid unnecessary pain & conflict. So don’t be too quick to judge & condemn. Instead,  be discerning!

The Almighty doesn’t care about your looks; what you do; who you know. He looks at your heart. Also you’re not defined by your past. It’s just the opposite with the world. People will look at all of the above & more. Get your priorities right. Who matters more? It’s your choice!

Beware what you think. Get rid of negative thoughts, assumptions, what ifs etc. They serve no purpose. If you keep replaying them, you’ll end up the loser. That’s what Satan wants. Most of the scenarios in your mind, won’t happen!  Clear out the cobwebs & start seeing light!

The Almighty looks at your heart. Your connections, achievements, accolades etc don’t matter. He’s watching if you act out of kindness, love & compassion. Or is it all about you. Society has become rather selfish. If your heart’s in the right place!, you’re on the right track!

You’re being tested again & again & you’re at breaking point. Hold on. Remember, a test can sometimes replace a worse misfortune; it could be a form of protection from something or being deprived of something. Take your tests in your stride, knowing He wants only good for you!

Beware the company you keep. Not all are supporters. Not all will cheer you on or want to see you succeed. In fact, some are happy when you fall and fail. Such is life. These are people who are jealous of your blessings. They want what the Almighty has given you. Pray for them!

When things go wrong as they often do, learn to look for answers from within. The trouble is many will lash out at others and blame people around them. It’s easier to focus outward and get reactive. That’s unwise. Moreover, that seldom solves the problem and often makes it worse!

Cut down on social media interactions. If you belong to numerous chat groups and other online platforms, put them all on the back burner. Do it now and don’t procrastinate. They have a way of making you fritter your time away. Focus on your acts of worship. Life’s too short.

Remind yourself that everything is temporary; nothing lasts. You’re on a journey. You’ve not reached your final destination yet. An eternal abode awaits. The Hereafter. So quit stressing over everything that happens. Let the Almighty take over after you’ve done your best!

No matter what you’re going through, the Almighty can bring the greatest blessings even with the worst of circumstances. You’ve got to believe that nothing is impossible with the Lord of the Worlds. Seek Him constantly and He will direct your steps. Ask Him to strengthen you!

Don’t keep things bottled up. It’s not healthy to hold your anxiety in. It can only get worse. Learn to open up, speak up and get help if you need to. There’s nothing wrong with that. We all need love and support. Seek your strength from the Almighty. He will pave a way out!

Almighty. Help us understand every step of our journey in this life. Let us bear good patience as we wait for our prayers to be answered and Your blessings to be revealed. Help us to always trust that Your timing is perfect and that You always work in our best interest! Aameen!

Almighty. Today we thank You for all the blessings You’ve bestowed on us. Thank You for hearing all the unspoken words we couldn’t utter because the hurt was too much to bear. Thank You for mending all our wounds, seen & unseen; and for making the pain more bearable. Aameen!

Almighty. Amidst the uncertainty & crisis facing us, we pray for the comfort & safety of everyone across the globe. We need Your guidance & direction. We are completely reliant on You, more so during these challenging times. May we always be grateful for what You have given us!

Don’t get involved in people’s drama & dysfunction. There’s a lot of that going on nowadays. As much as they try to engage you, take a step back. If they’re reasonable & open to discussion, you could try advising them. Else, stay clear or you could lose your peace altogether!

No matter how badly you’ve messed up, you’re NOT a failure. Don’t entertain that thought if it crosses your mind. As long as you’re seeking forgiveness & trying to get close to the Almighty, He will forgive you. That’s our Merciful Lord. His approval is all you need!

Freedom of expression doesn’t give you the right to abuse and insult others. When you engage in such intentional provocation, expect a reaction where things may spiral out of control. Never forget that freedom comes with responsibility. Ethical and moral standards must remain!

You’re miserable because you put your hopes in unreliable, undependable people who are always letting you down. That’s what happens when you favour the creation over the Creator. Lay your trust in the One who is  omnipresent and constant. The Almighty will never let you down.

Today, many lack basic respect usually due to poor upbringing. Remember, good manners & good character are more crucial than outward beauty. When the world treats you badly & everything is against you, do you turn around & give it the same treatment? No! You treat it better.

Forgive and move on. It’s powerful. It’s an act of kindness. It’s the beginning of healing. Yet many refuse to do so, preferring to cling on to grudges, resentment & payback time. It’s not worth it. Life’s too short for all that drama. Just forgive & keep that peace in you.

Don't insult others or mock them no matter who they are or what they believe. Don't curse or abuse, don't disrespect. You gain absolutely nothing by doing that. In fact, you will make many enemies. Sleep in peace every night knowing you haven't wronged a soul in any way.

Learn to be at peace with yourself. It’s something you have to do consciously. It won’t happen overnight. When you finally achieve it, nothing & no one can affect you. You’re totally in sync with your innermost self. No negativity can touch you! Feel the  difference!

Don’t fall into the trap of letting others snatch away your confidence. People tend to do that with their words and actions. Know their agenda. Don’t shrink back. As long as you’re doing what’s right, go forth. Remember, in the end, only the Almighty’s opinion matters!

Never think you’ve messed up too much that the Almighty won’t forgive you. He will & always will as long as you’re repenting & seeking forgiveness. Don’t let Satan make you feel otherwise. So no matter how far you’ve strayed, turn to Him without hesitation! Don’t procrastinate!

Almighty. Constantly remind us that eventually everything will work out. You’re in complete control. Help us wait patiently for what You have in store for us. Help us cultivate the right attitude. It’s not easy at times; but let it be worth it. Open the doors before us!

Stop stressing over things. The Almighty will work it out for you eventually. You have to trust Him. Remember, you don’t have to chase whatever He sends. That’s right! Because if you’re truly committed to His cause, the blessings will chase you .

If you ever doubt that you’ll make it through your trials, look back and see how the Almighty has favoured you and blessed you with so much. Know that it didn’t happen by accident. He planned it meticulously for you. Don’t take it for granted. Thank Him for all the goodness.

Almighty. Amidst the choas & confusion, we pray for peace & prosperity in Nigeria. Safeguard its citizens & guide its leaders to do what’s right. Protect #Nigeria from harm & those who intend to create turmoil, discord, hate & unrest. Grant it positive growth & success. Aameen

Almighty. When calamities and storms come into our lives, help us take them in our stride. Keep the peace and tranquility, simply because the hardship won’t last. When we feel broken, heal us so we can be whole again. May we always be under your protection. Aameen!

Don’t get discouraged when things don’t happen according to your timing. Pray that the Almighty grants you ultimate patience while you wait. Constantly remind yourself that the longer it takes, the more He has in store for you. You will be surprised & overjoyed with the outcome!

One of the biggest problems we face in our lives today is distraction! There’s too much going on around us that it’s hard to stay focused. Everything screams for our attention. Don't waste time on anything that doesn't improve and enhance your life in any way. Stay vigilant!

You don’t have to apologise if the answer is no! Be upfront & honest when you say it. Do it for self-care. Many can’t say no because they don’t want to appear rude or ill-mannered; & they’re concerned about the opinion of others. This is harmful behaviour. You’ve got to stop it!

People can only make you feel inferior if you give them the power to do so. Don’t do that. You don’t need their approval for anything in your life. The only approval you need is from the Almighty and no one else. Lay your trust in Him no matter what you’re going through in life.

Your cries to the Almighty are more than just tears. He knows what you’re feeling, what you’re saying even though you’re not articulating. He’s the Lord of the Worlds. So remember, even though you feel like you’re in a dark place right now, His light will shine through. Hold on.

Embrace pain. It’s part of the process. Nothing good is achieved when it’s all smooth sailing. Expect knocks, disappointment, falls etc. They allow you to grow into a better version of yourself. You have to trust the journey. The Almighty will grant you victory as a result!

Take life in your stride. Focus on your tasks and don’t get distracted. Leave the rest to the Almighty. Cut out the noise outside and don’t worry about trivial and petty issues. Remember, fitting in, people’s opinions of you etc don’t matter eventually. Life’s too short!

Stop comparing. Start cherishing what you have before it’s taken away from you. Gratitude is key. Be hopeful about what’s coming. Always believe that the Almighty wants good for us. He has blessed us with so much, more than we’ve asked for. Move forward with prayer & firm faith!

Cut out gossip. Cut out backbiting. Cut out empty chatter and wasting time. Fix yourself first. Get busy with self-improvement. Work on being a better version of yourself. At the end of the day, it’s really me vs me. You’re accountable for your own  actions. Nobody else’s!

Just because you don’t understand what’s going on, it doesn’t mean you give up hope and throw in the towel. Keep asking the Almighty. Keep crying out to Him for what you need. He knows what’s coming next, even if you don’t. Your job is to trust Him. Press on!

Correct others by all means but do it in a tasteful manner that they don’t get upset, defensive or even aggressive. Do it gently with kindness. Sometimes when you give advice, people become worse off than they were before you gave them advice because of the way you did it!

Stop overthinking. Calm down. Spiritual growth takes time. It doesn’t happen overnight. Just because your progress is not obvious does not mean nothing is happening. Keep praying. Keep believing. The Almighty’s in full control. He’ll make things happen when the time is right!

People will have an opinion of you & there is nothing you can do about it. It’s become easier to do that especially hiding behind the keyboard. It requires no accountability, no understanding. How about we cultivate empathy instead; the ability to feel what  others are feeling?

Almighty. Grant us the strength that we need to face today. There are things happening around us that we do not understand. At times, we feel weak, helpless & even afraid. We know You’re in full control & we trust You. Have mercy on us as we struggle to endure life’s hardships!

Stop putting yourself down.  Stop doubting how far you’ve come. Stop regretting the choices you’ve made. Satan will make you think otherwise. His job is to make you miserable and depressed. Don’t cave in. Always encourage, support and believe in yourself. That’s the way forward!

Almighty. Keep purifying our hearts of any resentment towards others. Help us to always be aware & conscious of You & to realise that our life is temporary. You can take us back any moment. Help us appreciate the value of time & to be aware of how precious & fleeting it is!

If you don't do it their way, it doesn't mean you're wrong, inferior or off the track. Let them say what they want. They'll never stop hurling abuse at you. Don't be distracted by their noise. Your worth is decided by the Almighty. Be dedicated to Him alone, not them. He knows.

In this age of constant distraction, focus is crucial in our relationship with the Almighty. This focus is not only meant for our daily prayers, but should stretch to every aspect of our lives. Living a distracted life leads nowhere as you’ll fall prey to the tricks of Satan!

Being hurt is unpleasant. More so if it’s by someone close to you or a person you care about. But it’s really unavoidable. In reality, that’s life. Don’t think too much about it. Let the Almighty heal you. Only He can. Gather your inner strength. Move on & push through the pain!

Always be kind to those you meet along the way in life. Remember, we’re all on a journey. Your journey is not the same as mine. And mine is not the same as yours. If we meet on a certain path, may we encourage each other and build each other up instead of tearing each other down.

Avoid the company of those who are  constantly complaining about other people. They make no effort to hide their discontent. Don't let them drag you into their pit of despair. Stay out of it but try to make them realise that they are the source of their own discontent!

Do your best and leave the rest to the Almighty. Think of all the times He’s brought you back on course when you felt lost. As long as you’re seeking Him, He will respond. The trauma, the scars, the suffering you thought would never end but He strengthened you through it all!

What got to you was never meant to miss you and what missed you was never ever meant to get to you! So don’t stress over what happens in life. Thank the Almighty for everything because the Lord of the Worlds is in full control. He knows what’s best for you  always!

Don’t expect everyone to share your vision & goals. Even those close to you may not. That’s life. We are all made differently. Your vision is unique to you. The Almighty crafted them specially for you. When you leave Him out of the equation, that’s when your vision becomes blur!

This year has taught us that no matter how meticulously you plan your life, the Almighty has the last say & the veto powers. That’s why it’s so important to live every moment & not take things for granted. Here today, gone tomorrow. We’ve seen that happen too often. Just live!

Stop procrastinating. When the Almighty opens a door for you be prepared to walk through it. But for some, it’s an opportunity lost because they’re too lazy to make the move in the direction that He has paved for them. Remember, an opportunity lost may never be regained.

Trust the Almighty with full conviction; with all your heart. Don’t lean on your own understanding. Often with our limited knowledge, we’re not able to see the whole picture. But He knows what we don’t. Acknowledge Him in all that you’re going through & He will direct your way.

Almighty. We have many things we’re worried about bombarding our brains. We know You’re in full control of everything and we’re not. We hand them over to You because of Your infinite Wisdom and Mercy. Grant us peace of mind, knowing that You always want the best for us. Aameen.

Almighty. Grant us guidance.
Show us which way to turn.
Calm our anxious thoughts. 
Strengthen us as we often falter and feel weary. Give us strength in our hearts and clarity of vision to go through our daily affairs. We know that You’re with us in our journey. Aameen.

It’s time to inhale the future and exhale the past. It’s easy to look back and ask all the “whys” and “ifs” but honestly it’s not going to change anything. Instead, gather the lessons the Almighty wanted you to learn along the way and move ahead with full trust in your heart!

There are people who will go out of their way for others. They’ll be there when times are rough, always ready with a listening ear. Don’t forget to check on them too. They may be facing struggles known only to them. Their cup may be empty having poured everything out for others!

Practice, patience & perseverance. These are essential ingredients if you want to excel in whatever you’re doing, Nothing comes easy. The Almighty has equipped you with the faculties & capabilities. Put them to good use. Sitting around,  waiting for things to happen won’t work!

Don’t be discouraged when you see others doing well. Don’t begrudge your friend for getting that job you’ve been eyeing for a while. You are almost there. What the Almighty is giving you requires patience, focus and commitment! Your time will come when He  makes it happen!

Focus on what matters. Choose positivity always. Negativity is not the vibe you want. If you allow it, negativity can sap your energy & leave you feeling drained. It can kill your inner peace. Recognise these symptoms & learn to make better choices. Leave the outside noise out!

Nothing lasts.  Even some of the people the Almighty sends our way are only meant to accompany us temporarily. Don’t be upset when He moves people out of your life. It’s His Plan. You need to carry on your journey. You’ll meet more along the way. He’s keeping an eye on you!

Don’t allow the hectic pace of your life to keep you away from praying. It’s easy to get overwhelmed by life’s responsibilities. Don’t. Take it in your stride. Don’t trade the  connection with your Creator for worldly things. Don’t miss out on the opportunity to he heard by Him!

The truth is most of us have more than we need. We have practically all the basic necessities and more. Sadly, we tend to look at the few things we don't have & become depressed & despondent. Be careful because the Almighty doesn’t like ingratitude. He can take it away. Anytime!

Whatever you’re healing from, be patient with yourself. Healing takes time. One minute you feel better, the next minute you’re down again. Expect the highs and lows. Seek your strength from the Almighty. Only He can heal you. Have faith in the process. You’ll emerge stronger!

The Almighty knows you’re doing your best. He knows you’re tired. He hears the prayers & sees the tears. Keep pressing forward. He won’t try you beyond your means. When you least expect it, doors will open, breakthroughs will come. The wait won’t be in vain! Trust Him!

Don’t waste time seeking people’s approval. They’re a hard lot to please & whatever you do will never be good enough. There will always be that one person who’s waiting to nitpick. Instead, spend time building your relationship with the Almighty. You’ll never be disappointed!

Don’t be among those who constantly feed their material desires while neglecting their souls. Most people focus on material things like houses, jobs, cars etc forgetting that balance is essential in life if you’re to attain contentment and inner peace. Prioritise what matters!

The best life lessons are often learnt when you’re broken badly. When you think you’ve hit rock bottom & can’t see a way out. But don’t forget that some of the greatest blessings in life become apparent & come through your most difficult trials. So take heart. Never lose hope!

Are you among those who treat others according to your temperament? If you’re happy, then you treat people kindly. And if you happen to be in a bad mood, you treat them any way you please, often in a bad manner. This is an ugly behaviour. Stay consistent in how you treat others!

Almighty. Help us to not stray into the temptations of this world. Keep us on the right path & let us be good examples for generations to come. Give us a deep sense of modesty that will be reflected in our external conduct. Protect us from that which will incur Your Wrath!

Almighty. Keep our hearts & minds pure & our paths straight. Help us to be discerning always & not to just conform to whatever life throws at us. May we take what’s good, acceptable & pleasing to You. Give us the strength to control our thoughts & speak what is true & honourable!

Don’t fall into the trap of publicising your sins on social media. Some people think it’s cool. It’s not. Keep your sins private between you and the Almighty. Repent soonest possible. When you show pride in the sin, that’s  worrying. You probably won’t be repenting for it too.

Be careful. There are many insecure & manipulative people out there who will use & abuse you. If you’ve fallen victim, forgive yourself for the bad decisions you’ve made. Move on with a better mindset. Such people will always exist. Be mindful the next time, with hindsight!

Choose peace over attention. Today, many crave attention that sometimes they do it at the expense of what is priceless. Yes. Peace. You often see the most mundane detail of someone’s life on social media, expecting likes & comments. Stay away from the fray. Maintain your dignity.

Will you help someone even if you know you’ll get nothing in return? The truth is anyone can help when there’s something in it for them but to help when there’s nothing to be gained shows a beautiful heart! It shows true sincerity. If you know someone like that, you’re blessed!

Everything goes according to His Divine Decree. That’s why life always works out because He wants the best for you. Even if it’s not according to your original plan, it’ll be in your favour. Find comfort knowing that everything you’re going through won’t last. Trust the process!

Oftentimes when you’re having a bad day, it’s because of your mindset. How often do you stress over things because you want more. You’re never content. Nothing is good enough. Adopt an attitude of gratitude. You’ll realise that life is more than enough. Learn to be grateful!

Remember the basic rule of life. You reap what you sow. Life’s often what you make of it. So don’t be upset when you didn’t get what you had expected because you didn’t put in the effort & didn’t do the work! That’s the brutal truth. The sooner you embrace that, the better!

Be in the company of good, positive people; those who are good for your mental health. Not those who will pick on you constantly & knock you down for the slightest wrong. During tough times like this, it’s crucial to keep your inner peace. Don’t let anything or anyone rattle you!

Don’t give up on your loved ones. Remember, not everyone will be on the same path as you and that’s life. Your job is to constantly pray for them, waiting for that turning point in their lives. Keep going. It will happen if the Almighty wills. Guidance comes from Him alone!

The higher you climb, the harder you fall. You’ve heard the saying. While that doesn’t necessarily have to be the case, in the midst of success, it’s important to remain grounded. Humility is key. Don’t let success get to your head. Remember, nothing happens without His Will.

Why do some people find it hard to compliment others? It reinforces positive self-esteem. As much as we like to receive compliments, it’s equally important to be willing to give them. Being able to recognize good things in others is a sign of emotional intelligence & maturity!

Listen with the intention to understand rather than to merely respond when discussing an issue. But oftentimes, we get so caught up with putting our points across that we forget to listen to what’s being said. Be fair, remain calm and committed to hearing each other out.

Do you understand the workings of Satan? He is always there, lurking around to attack you. Do not let him win! Stand firm & resolute. Fight back with prayer. Be unflinching in your faith. Be absolutely sure what needs to be done. Seek the Almighty’s help always. He’ll guide you!

Disappointment, setback, defeat are all temporary. The Almighty puts them in your path to strengthen you, not destroy you. How you react  and respond to it will show your mettle; the kind of person that you are. Keep going. Don’t give up. Giving up is what makes it permanent.

The biggest enemy to contentment is the yearning for what we don’t have. How often do you tell yourself, I’ll be happy when I get this promotion or that job? This is conditional happiness; it may never happen! In fact, it will ruin your chance at happiness. Live in the moment!

Always ask the Almighty to protect our hearts from hardening. May He soften them and allow us to have compassion for those who are suffering in unimaginable ways. Learn to pray passionately for them as we do for ourselves and our loved ones. May He keep us humble at all times!

Avoid overthinking. Don’t read too much into things. Don’t delve and dig into something looking for issues when there are none or at least not obvious. Don’t complicate things when they’re really quite simple and easily understood. Remember, simplicity is part of faith.

Almighty. Protect us from hypocrisy. Make us honour every word that comes from our mouth. Give us humility to see how far from perfect we are and how badly we need You in our lives. Help us to live lives that glorify You. Help us to realize when we’re being judgemental of others!

Know your self-worth. You might feel unwanted & unworthy to one person, but you are priceless to another.  Spend time with those who value you. No matter how good you are to others, there’ll always be that one negative person who criticizes you.  Smile, carry on & do your thing!

Something you’ve been working on for a while didn’t work out. Don’t throw in the towel. Don’t fret. The Almighty knows the reason. He wants you to move forward. He wants you to let go of what didn’t work out yesterday & trust that He is leading you towards goodness. Keep moving!

The future is ahead of you. Stop hankering for what was & what you’ve left behind. Move on! Do not look back! Remember that everything happens for a reason. Review your past, learn the lessons meant for you. Be excited about what’s ahead & what the Almighty has planned for you!

Many will promise to do things for you but when it comes to the crunch, they’ll not keep to their word. Try not to depend on people. If you have to, be prepared to be disappointed. Remember, you are what you do, not what you say you’ll do. Rely on no one but the One who made you!

Hold on to your faith. Stay firm & resolute. Don’t let circumstances sway you like a candle in the wind. Never doubt that the Almighty’s aware of everything that’s going on. Don’t let others create doubts in your mind. He has brought you this far. Do you think He’ll abandon you?

There’s a blessing when you’re down and at your lowest. The only way you can move is up. Thank the Almighty for it because He will raise you if you seek Him. Keep reaching out to Him and you’ll be amazed by what follows. Your experience and breakthrough will be phenomenal!

Don’t be full of pride and arrogance just because you’ve done good deeds. It’s up to the Almighty to accept it, though we must never lose hope in His Mercy. This is the only way to keep our hearts rooted to our faith. So keep doing good, no matter what is going on around you!

Nothing lasts. That’s right. Not even the ache in your heart. Everything is transient in this temporary world. So everything that you’re experiencing will give way to something better. The Almighty has promised us. So put Your trust in Him. He decrees everything, lest you forget.

Don’t waste time trying to change people’s perceptions & opinions of you. Most have already made up their minds. Many have preconceived ideas based on what they’ve heard through the grapevine. Keep doing good. Your work is there for everyone to see. The truth will always prevail!

Saying yes is a good thing mostly. But learning how to set boundaries & say no when the need calls for it is key to healthy relationships with others & yourself! Saying yes to everyone leads to stress, being overwhelmed & burned out. So listen to your body & don’t feel guilty!

Are you worried about being popular & loved by the masses? If you choose to get closer to the Almighty & live a life according to His Plan, you’ll find yourself walking alone mostly. This is the reality. Don’t be afraid. Don’t worry. Let Him take over as your Guide & Protector!

Don’t be daunted by the road ahead. Yes, it may seem long. But the Almighty has it all planned for you. You need to start the journey even if it’s with baby steps. You will pick up speed and your pace will quicken as you move along. Distractions aside, we will all get there!

Learn to live with criticism. It’s part of life. In this day and age, you’ll face critics at every turn; everywhere you go. Take it in your stride. Don’t stress over it. If it’s constructive criticism, use it to improve yourself. If it’s destructive, ignore it. Let it go!

Even when you feel lonely, you’re never really alone. The Almighty is always there for you. You don't have to live your life alone. He promises never to leave nor forsake you. He is ever faithful. Don't trade Him for anything. Make Him your priority. He will never disappoint!

Don’t let anyone belittle you. If you’re not careful, you may start believing their demeaning remarks. This can affect your self-esteem. When someone belittles you, it’s a reflection of them, not you! Never allow people who use words so irresponsibly to sabotage your self-image!

Are you feeling tired & discouraged? To get out of the rut, you need to change your mindset. Adopt positive thoughts. Believe that the Almighty wants good for you. He will give you strength & power to overcome. Start moving towards Him. Trust the process & feel the difference.

Almighty. We ask You for a heart that’s pure; free from grudges, malice & all things evil. Keep compassion alive in us. Help us refrain from judging others as we’ve not walked in their shoes. Keep our hearts at ease; make us pleased with Your Decree. We ask for Your Mercy always.

Don’t be disillusioned with life. Not everyone will appreciate what you do for them. Don’t be discouraged as there are many ungrateful people out there. You just have to figure out who’s worth your efforts & who’s merely using you. Focus your energy on what pleases the Almighty.

Do you find it hard to forgive those who’ve wronged you? Learn to cultivate a generous & caring spirit. It’ll serve as a reminder of the importance of showing mercy to others. We can be so harsh to each other over small things, but don’t we hope for the Almighty’s Mercy?

We care so much for our physical being but how about our soul? It’s the soul that lives on, not our bodies which we so painstakingly look after. Remember, anyone can feed your stomach but only you can feed your soul. Start today by doing what the Almighty has prescribed.

We embody what we talk about. If you’re always having a negative mindset, always complaining, doubting, making a big deal of all your problems, then you’re bringing all the wrong things to life. Your words can take you away from your destiny. Think positive. Act positively!

In conclusion

I personally will make a new intention every night. If you fear that you may forget to make intention, then make one intention tonight (on the first night of Ramadan) that is meant for the whole month.

Pls consult your respective teachers for more info.

As for the Hanafi school of thought, their view is that as long as a Muslim refrains from eating and drinking as well as every other act that would invalidate one's fast during the month of Ramadan, then the fast is considered valid.

The Maliki school of thought are of the opinion that a person may make one intention that is meant for the entire month.

This is because the fasts in Ramadan are done consecutively throughout the 29 or 30 days.

Because the place of intention is in the heart.

As the famous Hadith goes, "Verily, actions are judged by their intentions."

This opinion also says that if a person forgets to make the intention the night before may do so in the day as long as it is before noon time.

Another group of scholars who share a similar point of view that an intention should be made for each day of fasting opine that it is enough for a person to resolve in their heart the commitment to want to fast - without the need to verbalise the intentions clearly.

They added that the intention must explicitly include the mention of "Ramadan", to specify that it is an obligatory fast.

And the timing for this intention should be made between Maghrib and before Subuh. Based on the earlier Hadith.

Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) said,

"He who does not make the intention for fasting before dawn, there is no fast for him." (meaning, the fast is not valid) - Narrated by Imam At-Tirmizi

Some scholars are of the opinion that a specific intention must be made for each day.
